31.23.text:
That is right Rieky. Welcome to Fieldsports
Britain. Coming to you this week from Namibia.

39.50.text:
That is my line. It is cheaper than stalking
stags in Scotland. It is cheaper than shooting

44.30.text: pheasants in England. What is it Rieky?

52.66.text: First it is Test Splat Special.

59.62.text:
Welcome to our weekly look at bangs and splashes.
Now, we know fizzy drinks can do crazy things

64.93.text:
to our children. And this week's Test Splat
Special is pure science. Seeking to find out

70.61.text:
which of the three combinations of sugar and
bubbles from the Coca-Cola Company is least

75.60.text: likely to make your child do this.

78.87.text:
We are of course in Namibia. With the benefit
of Norma Oryx softpoint ammunition, we can

84.22.text:
shoot cans of Coke, Coke Light, Sprite and
(for science's sake) water to see which one

89.58.text:
is bubbliest and splashes the furthest. That
is the one not to give your kids, right?

95.49.text:
So we are shaking the cans, putting them on
a post exactly 22.8 centimetres (no idea why

99.95.text:
we picked that number) from a large white
piece of paper. Shoot each drink with a .30-06

105.67.text:
round and see whether it splashes just the
paper, splashes the ground around, or even

110.72.text: splashes the camera six feet away.

113.78.text:
First up is full fat Coca-Cola. It gets the
shaking Stevens treatment. Our tame target

118.32.text:
shooter applies the finger to the trigger
and there's brown sweet stuff all over the

122.92.text: paper. But it goes no further than that.

127.92.text:
Next we go for Sprite. Also contains 35 grams
of sugar. That is like having a cuppa with

132.83.text:
seven teaspoons of sugar in it. Off goes the
round. Don not forget these bullets cost more

137.78.text:
than these drinks. And its splash goes beyond
the paper and on to the ground around. Is

143.98.text:
Finally, Coke Light, still called Diet Coke
in the UK, which uses the horrifyingly named

150.09.text:
Nutra-Sweet instead of sugar. It might not
have the jungle juice content of proper Coke

154.73.text:
but we want to know what it is like as a launch
vehicle. Does it deliver all that Cokey loveliness

159.84.text:
to your child quickly with its bubbles? Bang
goes the cartridge and - yes my goodness - it

165.29.text:
is a camera splatterer. Diet Coke passes the
fizzical for fizziest of the three drinks.

173.76.text:
Now how about water. We are expecting this
one to put a dampener on things and, oh dear,

178.23.text: what a wash-out. It certainly does.

180.86.text:
So, the message to mums is this: if you have
to buy your child a fizzy drink, choose bright

185.87.text:
red Coca Cola. It is the least fizzy of the
three sodas we tested and will obviously therefore

191.31.text:
do your child less harm. Well done if you
chose it - nothing proved nothing gained.

196.03.text:
Next week, we send a big game hunter to the
Large Hadron Collider to knock down a Higg's

200.35.text:
Well that is enough mucking around with fizzy
drinks. It is time for the real deal. We are

229.46.text:
There really is something special about hunting
in Africa. We are lucky enough to have been

240.79.text:
invited to join a group of Zeiss dealers on
the trips of their lifetimes to Blaser's ranch

246.89.text:
They are being offered the chance to hunt
oryx trophies and, if they have the funds,

252.18.text:
red hartebeest, zebra, wildebeest and kudu
are all on offer.

257.21.text:
As well as top high-transmission glasswear
perched on top of quality Blaser R8 rifles

263.05.text:
we are also using Norma Oryx softpoint ammunition.
Before the Spanish party get a chance to hunt

269.57.text: they need to prove themselves on the range.

273.19.text:
They have to show they are competent off sticks.
If you are 
considering a hunting safari to Africa, speed,

286.39.text:
confidence and stable shooting off sticks
is crucial. The professional hunter is there

292.98.text:
Afterwards, as a big treat, we head up to
one of the highest points on the 24,000 hectare

298.60.text:
range for a sundowner. There is nothing quite
like an African sunset - with all it's visual

304.54.text:
delights. It is a moment to relax and enjoy
before an early start after those oryx.

314.85.text:
We join Alejandro and his wife Patricia. They
are both experienced hunters and to add extra

320.64.text:
spice to the hunt it is Alejandro's 38th birthday.
Our first port of call is a rocky outcrop

327.10.text:
called a koppie. Just like in the Scottish
Highlands, the guides find a vantage point

335.29.text:
We return to ground level and head off on
foot. The tracker is on constant look out

339.99.text:
for fresh droppings and tracks - literally
following in the footsteps of our game.

345.82.text:
A half an hour walk brings us to another koppie.
There is a group of wildebeest below us. We

351.02.text:
get a glimpse and then we climb to a higher
position to get a better view. They move off,

358.68.text:
There is always a sense of purpose with these
trackers, which gives confidence to a shooter

365.26.text:
We get close, but not close enough.Wildlife
crosses our path but unfortunately not the

371.59.text:
variety we want. After two-and-a-half hours
we get a look at our first oryx.

379.01.text:
She stays still enough for Patricia to get
steady - and she drops her where she stands.There

395.74.text:
Patricia is the only woman in the group. Is
it rare in Spain for women to hunt?

400.97.text:
All the time, more and more women are going
hunting. The first time they go with their

410.00.text:
husband or a friend, and later they get themselves
involved with hunting. But to be honest it

412.95.text: still not common. Still many more male hunters.

415.53.text:
Yes. It is a marvellous experience. It is
part of my heart. It is very emotional. It

418.42.text:
increases the adrenalin and I can recommend
it totally.

426.25.text:
It is certainly a moment to be cherished and
recorded. The Zeiss scope, Blaser R8 rifle

432.74.text:
and Norma ammunition have all played their
roles.

436.13.text:
For African hunting Zeiss recommends a 50mm
objective lense, giving flatter shooting while

443.93.text:
The 50 is very interesting for Africa, because
you go out very early in the morning. So this

449.84.text:
morning we started at 6 o'clock and it was
nearly dark. And when we were on the first

455.20.text:
stand for oryx it was 6.30. It was still not
really day light. Therefore the 50 objective

462.40.text:
lense really gets you the extra 5 minutes.
In Europe people use the 56, but here in Africa

468.10.text:
they use the 50. It has a big advantage. You
can mount the scope lower on the rifle, because

476.63.text: here we have not as much space.

479.58.text:
Norma ammunition has a strong association
with African game. With its 100-plus calibres

485.91.text:
there is something for all shapes and sizes.
Jörgen Sandström from the company is hunting

491.64.text:
with us. And having spoken to the professional
hunters here, they are all in agreement that

498.93.text:
They are saying the bigger the better, because
if you have a shot which is not properly positioned

505.96.text:
on the animal, the chance to get the animal
and find it is better if you have a bigger

512.64.text:
calibre. So shoot as big calibre as you can
handle. Of course you have the recoil that

521.39.text:
is the bad side of a big calibre. If you can
handle the recoil, then use a big gun.

528.08.text:
All the Spanish hunters are using Blaser rifles.
The innovative gun manufacturer has produced

532.65.text:
a system which allows you to shoot foxes in
Felixstowe one day and elephant in Africa

538.25.text:
It is a very versatile rifle and it is what
we say one rifle for around the world. Because

544.60.text:
of the interchangability of the rifle you
can change the barrels, you can change the

547.80.text:
bolt head, which means changing calibre groups.
You can go from a miniature calibre group

552.58.text:
up to a magnum. So that equates to a 222 Remington
up to a 500 Jeffery. So I can literally hunt

559.58.text:
in today 222 fox hunting. Tomorrow 9.3 by
62 for wild boar in Germany and the day after

567.58.text: that I can go to Africa and use a 500 Jeffrey.

571.28.text:
While Alejandro and Patricia are out in one
part of the 60,000-acre ranch, Zak and Rafael

577.13.text:
are out in another. It is their first day
hunting and they are excited.

590.72.text:
It is an early start, but this is the best
time of day for hunting. Hunting guide Karel

597.27.text:
He suddenly stops the engine and we are off
in to the bush. We make a wide circle before

602.82.text:
Karel decides we are out of luck. Maybe the
wind is not being kind, maybe the animals

608.13.text: heard us coming, but they are off.

610.34.text:
What happened was, he was running. He already
knew we were here. So he started running off,

616.50.text:
so we tried walking behind him. The wind is
bad as well. The wind is from behind us. We

626.94.text:
will try and walk through and see if he stopped
may be. This one got away.

635.14.text:
Suddenly stopping the car because he has seen
something indistinguishable to the ordinary

639.03.text:
human eye but blindingly obvious to the hunting
guide's eye becomes a pattern for the morning.

644.49.text:
After a few of the attempts, the Spanish start
to play games.

649.73.text:
We reach a koppie with views across the thorny
scrub. We spot oryx and they are close enough

655.19.text:
for a shot. The shot is good, but the animal
runs.

658.86.text:
It was very emotional. We saw the oryx leaving
the bushes into the open area, but we were

667.92.text:
too noisy, stones moved and we failed to get
close.

670.57.text:
I could not see anything. But we are just
going to go down and make sure there is no

683.02.text:
blood. If there is blood because it is down
in the valley it is difficult to hear. So

691.81.text: we are just going to do that quickly.

694.70.text:
With frothy red blood on the ground, the shot
is true. But this beast will need tracking.

700.16.text:
Time to let slip the Westphalian Terrier,
Biene. The only trouble is the trail. Our

710.67.text:
It got darker and darker. Which means it is
coming from somewhere else. It is not lung

716.98.text:
tissue blood. We started walking and after
a while it stopped. We did not find any more

727.15.text:
drops. Which is bad, with the long grass it
is difficult to see the drop. As soon as it

734.36.text:
starts getting smaller drops it is difficult
to see.

738.82.text:
The thorns here are incredible, and Zak has
shot his oryx in one of the thorniest parts

743.61.text:
of the ranch. These are not ordinary thorns.
These are the stuff of horror movies.

749.55.text:
One of the thorns here is called Wait-a-Bit.
Another one has the local latin name of Landrovia

754.17.text:
Flatwheelia. They make tracking hard. Biene
comes back with nothing. Less Westphalia terrier,

762.78.text:
As a guide, how do you feel about the situation
where you have got a wounded animal, but you

767.73.text:
cannot find it? How do you personally feel
about that?

772.63.text:
Very bad. The animal was shot. The animal
was wounded. We found blood. So the next thing

778.96.text: we have to do is find it.

782.70.text:
Back to our hunting couple on the other side
of the range, and we leave Patricia being

786.34.text:
congratulated in the traditional German way.
While our birthday boy Alejandro heads off

792.03.text:
into the distance with guide Erifrisse. We
only have half an hour before it gets too

797.79.text:
hot. The animals stop moving and before we
need to head back to the lodge for a cooling

804.12.text:
In complete contrast to the marathon we have
just survived we spot another oryx within

809.25.text:
10 minutes. Alejandro doesn't mess about.
He shoots and he is confident he has hit the

817.97.text:
Still, as is the case with a lot of African
game, our oryx has managed to put some distance

825.34.text:
The 300-calibre Norma Oryx round has probably
killed the animal, but our guide needs to

830.32.text:
take his time to follow the tracks. He finds
the Oryx 50 yards deeper into the bush.

836.48.text:
The shot is excellent. Our Spanish hunter
has been shooting since he was a boy. So is

841.82.text: it is first taste of Africa?

843.87.text:
Yes, it is my first time in Africa and, to
be honest, it is an experience you will never

852.74.text:
forget. It is a dream for every hunter. It
is something every hunter would like to do

859.30.text:
at least once in his lifetime. And the truth
is, I thought the hunt would be different.

866.89.text: But it is a pure and authentic hunt.

871.22.text:
We are soon joined by Patricia and Stefan.
It is another successful hunt and what is

877.23.text: more the animal appears to be a gold medal.

879.46.text:
It is a very old female. The 2 horns are approximately
95cm. Both very nicely big here. So that is

893.00.text:
most probably a gold medal for the Alejandro
and as it is his birthday he just owned it.

901.98.text: It is a really nice one.

903.54.text:
It is incredible how he walked about 10 kilometres
and then walked about 500 metres and got one.

911.45.text:
Yes sometimes it takes hours and then sometimes
a couple of minutes. So yes, you have to work

919.37.text:
Do you have to be quite fit to do African
safaris?

922.91.text:
Yes, sure. You have to climb up on the Koppies
you have to go through the bush. Like this

930.34.text:
morning, 2 ½ hours when it was 12 or 14 degrees,
but now we are having round about 28 degrees.

939.50.text:
So it gets hot. You need to drink a lot. And
then continue walking.

944.91.text:
Unlike a roebuck this oryx can not be thrown
over the shoulder and walked out. The guides

945.13.text:
have a well choreographed routine and the
two animals are on board the Land Cruiser

946.05.text:
It may have taken a few more man hours, but
we are happy to report that Karel and guide

950.72.text:
Gabriel eventually found Zak's oryx. They
really don not like losing animals here.

960.47.text:
Now from the great beasts of the African grasslands
to the other end of the scale. It is David

965.82.text: on the Fieldsports Channel News Stump.

976.95.text:
A shooting shop in the North-East of England
was surprised when Barclaycard turned it down

982.74.text:
for a credit card machine. Rob Walecki runs
Emma Custom Rifles in Darlington. Barclaycard

988.79.text:
told him that "selling guns and firearms is
not something that Barclaycard support". We

994.03.text:
contacted Barclaycard, who climbed down a
bit. A spokesman said: "Barclaycard do occasionally

999.79.text:
place restrictions on the businesses we process
transactions on behalf of and the details

1004.82.text: of this case are currently being reviewed."

1007.34.text:
We are now just a few weeks away from National
Shooting Week 2012, which will take place

1013.40.text:
between 2nd and 10th June. During the week,
shooting clubs and grounds across the UK are

1019.36.text:
offering discounted lessons to all newcomers.
Absolutely no experience is necessary and

1024.84.text:
lessons can cater for people of all ages.
To take part in an event over the half term,

1035.81.text:
Airguns could be banned in Scotland, according
to Scottish justice secretary Kenny MacAskill.

1041.18.text:
He has pledged to the parents of toddler Andrew
Morton, who was murdered by an airgun shooter

1046.33.text:
taking potshots at passers-by from a window,
that airguns would be banned. His campaign

1052.30.text:
is backed by former Scottish parliament member
Tommy Sheridan, who is currently serving three

1056.74.text:
years in jail for perjury. MacAskill - the
justice secretary who released the Lockerbie

1061.29.text:
bomber from jail - has to get his plans past
the Scottish Government first.

1066.37.text:
And finally, big bird news. While Charlie
swans around Africa, perhaps he should watch

1070.77.text:
out for this traffic problem filmed in Saudi
Arabia. The ostrich was filmed running through

1075.21.text:
busy lanes of traffic, bringing cars to a
standstill and almost causing accidents in

1079.16.text: Saudi Arabia's southern town of Abha.

1083.17.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Britain
News. Stalking the stories. Fishing for facts.

1093.24.text:
Anything can happen in Africa. We were having
dinner in here last night when somebody rang

1097.52.text: to say there was a leopard in their laundry.

1100.27.text:
Basically what has happened is, one of my
employees told me yesterday, they heard something

1106.17.text:
last night. The dogs started barking. They
did not think anything of it. But this morning

1112.84.text:
when they got up they saw in the wash room
there was a small little grey duiker killed

1118.88.text:
by a certain predator which they thought was
a lynx at that stage. So they thought they

1126.32.text:
would try and find out what it was. They have
set a trap. I have just had a call now to

1134.60.text:
say the lynx has turned into a young leopard.
Now I just want to see the age of the leopard.

1144.97.text:
Then we are going to try and release it back
into the wild. It is a little bit dangerous,

1150.35.text: but let us have a look and see what happens.

1154.78.text:
It is a young leopard. I am just going to
walk up. It looks like a female. It is definitely

1172.88.text:
a youngster. That is a small one making that
noise. So now you can imagine what a big does.

1178.66.text: Nothing too serious, just a little leopard.

1182.33.text:
Do you often have such things in your back
garden.

1186.67.text:
No this is the first time. We have not been
here long.

1190.38.text:
2 weeks ago it was a porcupine and today it
is a leopard. May be in 3 days we will have

1196.80.text: a baby elephant in the cage.

1199.13.text:
So how are we going to be fast enough to open
the gate and then all run back to the car,

1207.59.text: so she does not attack us?

1211.49.text: Is it my job, very good.

1215.31.text:
Let us see what we can do here, without getting
hurt.

1227.97.text:
Not that long. I definitely do not want anybody
at the back of the vehicle.

1235.48.text: Could we all be inside the vehicle?

1239.28.text:
One guy into the vehicle no problem and one
guy into the house, because on the back it

1245.70.text: Where would you like to be David.

1247.72.text: I will go in the car.

1254.75.text:
Tie that around. I will....just put it on
top.

1259.80.text:
Put it around that and see if we can pull
it like that.

1271.18.text: We want to release you. Calm down.

1284.52.text:
The decision is made to move the leopard to
a position where we can release her. Even

1289.61.text:
knowing there's a lot of metal work between
me and her, every bone in my body is saying

1294.31.text: keep away, but I need to lend a helping hand.

1298.26.text:
We are confident that Marc knows what he's
doing. He has been dealing with dangerous

1306.10.text:
Sensibly, we take cover in the house and leave
the camera to capture the leopard's run for

1311.41.text:
freedom. A few slippers are thrown as encouragement
and finally she is off. Once she's disappeared

1317.69.text:
into the night we are bold enough to venture
out, but Marc decides to end the evening by

1326.98.text: I don't know why I didn't panic, but you did.

1334.96.text:
I don't know why, but I am going to have to
kill you!

1346.56.text:
That is the most frightening thing. When that
cat comes straight at you. Made me swear,

1355.01.text:
I may have got out on the gullible side of
the bed this morning!

1358.71.text:
Marc's farm manager shows us the washroom
where he found the duiker.

1362.97.text:
Something fell over so I came and had a look
and found a duiker in here.

1369.51.text:
We have badgers in the back room, but we don't
have duikers with leopards on them. Extraordinary.

1371.91.text: Definitely the first time for me also.

1375.16.text:
I just want to find out about your shoes.
If you could just zoom in on those shoes.

1383.68.text: They are definitely leopard proof shoes.

1387.43.text: I am quite fast in these ones.

1394.54.text: The leopard skin is underneath his pants.

1396.46.text:
A leopard is not really something you would
want around when there are children about.

1406.59.text:
Happily no one is hurt. This leopard gets
to fight another day and will hopefully now

1416.04.text:
Of course Namibia is a country famous for
hunting leopard. There is a great respect

1420.49.text:
for them here. However, in certain quarters
farmers are keen to see them poisoned, or

1427.62.text:
Mark and the Blaser ranch carefully manage
the animals that pass through their range.

1433.16.text:
A leopard hunter has just arrived at the lodge
and is going to pay handsomely for the chance

1438.13.text:
of shooting one. But first you have to get
close enough.

1442.79.text:
So you have got a leopard hunter coming haven't
you Mark.

1447.75.text: And what have you got ready for him?

1449.70.text:
Well we have pre-bated. Pre-bated means basically
we have scouted around. Checked for tracks

1456.33.text:
of big male leopards and hung meat up into
specific trees which think he would like to

1462.91.text: climb up on to, to eat the meat.

1465.06.text:
You have got this thing where farmers want
all the leopards shot, but the Namibian government

1469.49.text:
is very careful about which leopards can be
shot. Is that right?

1471.39.text:
Correct, they have implemented very strict
rules on leopard hunting. There is a minimum

1477.44.text:
size that a leopard has to be to be exported
as well as .... have only issued 250 tags

1487.95.text:
The hunting may be cheap, but the lodge is
luxurious. Let us have a quick look around.

1505.36.text:
Safari lodges can be so comfortable you sometimes
wonder who would really want to get all dusty

1510.70.text: and go hunting. Well, quite a few of us actually.

1514.70.text:
The accommodation here at Blaser's Sney River
Lodge is 5 star, with stunning views, private

1520.32.text:
pools, fabulous food, and dancing - but only
on special occasions.

1526.20.text:
This exclusive destination prides itself on
delivering great service whether hunting hard

1532.86.text:
We try and sell a 5 Star service throughout.
So obviously what you see here is not your

1540.24.text:
normal hunting farm. Not your normal hunting
lodge. The food we serve, the people we have

1546.63.text:
working here are of a certain level. That
is what we try to get.

1562.56.text:
This is of course the top end. There are safaris
to fit all budgets and this is what we are

1567.14.text:
keen to impress upon you, the viewer. There
are plenty of options for people from all

1572.47.text:
over the globe to go to Africa for the African
experience. For a traditional UK stalker the

1579.00.text:
costs are not prohibitive, especially when
you consider what you can pay for our deer.

1584.65.text:
In Africa, you can get so much more hunting
for your money if you know what to ask for,

1589.55.text: plus you might get a sun tan.

1592.08.text:
Not only in Namibia, but in southern Africa
with the increasing number of game farms around,

1599.17.text:
there is a surplus amount of animals around,
not all trophy animals. Often females need

1604.32.text:
to be shot younger often younger male animals
need to be shot . It is an ideal way for a

1610.18.text:
beginner or somebody who has hunted everything,
to come out and just enjoy a shooting holiday,

1617.41.text:
or a hunting holiday is the right word. He
can come, he can shoot with us here in Namibia.

1623.92.text:
You can shoot oryx for 150 euros. You can
shoot 10 oryx for 1,500 euros where in Scotland

1631.37.text:
or in Hungary you shoot one animal for that
price over 3 days. Whereas here you come for

1636.82.text:
the whole week. You are hunting every day.
You are experiencing the hunt for not a lot

1643.06.text:
For more information about Sney River Lodge
in Namibia go www.blaser-safaris.com

1650.13.text:
Now for our weekly roundup of what is hot
on YouTube

1656.72.text:
It is Hunting YouTube, showing the best hunting,
shooting and fishing videos that YouTube has

1661.50.text: to offer, and this week with an African slant.

1664.58.text:
There are lots of where-it-all-goes wrong
videos on Youtube but none so dramatic as

1669.06.text:
lion hunting going wrong. Here's one of them
called 'Lion attack hunting safari Africa'

1674.26.text:
that's been watched more than 8 million times.
You can not argue with numbers like that.

1680.15.text:
There are nearly 1,000 Cape buffalo hunts
to look at on YouTube. This one shows a close

1684.94.text:
call with a buff that is down - but gets up.
Sometimes called the closest Cape Buffalo

1690.11.text:
charge ever caught on film, this was filmed
in Tanzania in 1990.

1694.85.text:
African fishing is worth crossing continents
for. Chris Bailey catches a 106lb Nile perch

1700.82.text:
on Lake Nasser in Egypt in this film. Tiddler
- locals pulled a 500lber out of Lake Victoria.

1707.88.text:
One of the most prolific Africa hunting channels
on YouTube is AfricaHunting. It has a variety

1712.86.text:
of videos including shot placement on various
big game animals, bowhunting exploits and

1717.45.text:
this film about unusual quarry in Namibia
that could be a late entrant to the Big Five.

1723.31.text:
Elephant hunting films produce more hatred
from antis on YouTube than any other hunting

1727.50.text:
subject. Ignore the vitriol and watch this
film of a superbly professional professional

1732.92.text:
hunter at work. It takes six minutes to get
there on the film but it is an elephant hunt

1738.77.text:
White men with rifles are not the only hunters
in Africa and this clip from the BBC shows

1743.54.text:
San Bushmen engaged in what is called 'persistence'
hunting - literally running down their game.

1749.33.text: Must remember to try this at home with deer.

1752.18.text:
FourSeasonsUK, the YouTube channel for the
UK-based hunting agent of the same name, has

1756.42.text:
films about hunting all sorts across Africa,
from jackal on the ground to birds up above.

1761.55.text:
When they go dove shooting in South Africa,
the skies literally darken.

1765.00.text:
Rhinos are leading the charge when it comes
to being poached in Africa. With rhino horn

1770.25.text:
now more expensive than gold. Many countries
are meeting fire with fire and shooting down

1775.16.text:
poachers on sight. Ted Riley from Swaziland
is a pioneer of this policy and this film

1781.20.text:
from 2004 profiles him - and his single minded
approach to catching up wildlife in order

1789.14.text:
You can click on any of these films to watch
them. If you have a YouTube film you would

1792.58.text:
like us to pop in to the weekly top eight,
send it in via YouTube, or email me the link

1798.88.text:
Now, we all know there is no camouflage like
real tree camouflage and this week Team Wild

1806.49.text:
TV is hunting boar and deer in Germany. Click
on the angry buck which has appeared in the

1811.95.text: sky up there and you can watch that film.

1817.19.text: Well, we are back next week.

1820.21.text:
Got that. It is our usual stuff about constant
contact, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube. This

1835.20.text: That is right. We love Namibia.
